message_1: Find the derived category of coherent sheaves on a non-singular cubic curve $C$ in $\mathbb{P}^2$.
message_2:
The derived category of coherent sheaves on a non-singular cubic curve $C$ in $\mathbb{P}^2$ is denoted by $D^b(\text{Coh}(C))$. It is a triangulated category that is generated by the structure sheaf $\mathcal{O}_C$ and its twists by the Serre line bundle $\mathcal{O}_C(1)$.

To compute the derived category, we can use the Beilinson spectral sequence. The Beilinson spectral sequence is a tool that relates the derived category of coherent sheaves on a projective variety to the derived category of graded modules over a polynomial ring.

For a non-singular cubic curve $C$ in $\mathbb{P}^2$, the Beilinson spectral sequence takes the form:

$$E_2^{p, q} = \bigoplus_{i \in \mathbb{Z}} H^q(C, \mathcal{O}_C(p - 2q + i)) \Rightarrow D^b(\text{Coh}(C))$$

The cohomology groups $H^q(C, \mathcal{O}_C(p - 2q + i))$ can be computed using the Riemann-Roch theorem and Serre duality. For a non-singular cubic curve, we have:

$$H^0(C, \mathcal{O}_C(n)) = \begin{cases}
0 & \text{if } n < 0 \\
1 & \text{if } n = 0 \\
n+1 & \text{if } n > 0
\end{cases}$$

and

$$H^1(C, \mathcal{O}_C(n)) = \begin{cases}
0 & \text{if } n \geq -1 \\
-n & \text{if } n < -1
\end{cases}$$

Using these cohomology groups, we can compute the $E_2$ page of the Beilinson spectral sequence:

$$E_2^{p, q} = \begin{cases}
\mathbb{C} & \text{if } p = q = 0 \\
\mathbb{C}^{p+1} & \text{if } p > 0 \text{ and } q = 0 \\
\mathbb{C}^{-p} & \text{if } p < 0 \text{ and } q = 1 \\
0 & \text{otherwise}
\end{cases}$$

Since the Beilinson spectral sequence degenerates at the $E_2$ page, we have:

$$D^b(\text{Coh}(C)) \cong \bigoplus_{p \in \mathbb{Z}} \bigoplus_{q = 0}^1 E_2^{p, q}$$

Thus, the derived category of coherent sheaves on a non-singular cubic curve $C$ in $\mathbb{P}^2$ is generated by the structure sheaf $\mathcal{O}_C$ and its twists by the Serre line bundle $\mathcal{O}_C(1)$, with the cohomology groups given above.
